intro: Peucedanum marginatum, commonly known as the fringed cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia and parts of Europe. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky or dry soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Peucedanum marginatum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
